DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the temperature range of fever.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to fever, a disorder characterized by elevation of the body's temperature above the upper limit of normal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by elevation of the body's temperature above the upper limit of normal.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by elevation of the body's temperature above the upper limit of normal.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses._The degree of hotness or coldness of a body or environment._The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

PermissibleValues.value: > 40° C / > 104° F for more than 24 hours
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than 40 Degree Celsius Or Greater Than 104 Degree Fahrenheit For More Than 24 Hours

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than 40 Degree Celsius Or Greater Than 104 Degree Fahrenheit For More Than 24 Hours
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A body temperature of greater than 40 degree Celsius or greater than 104 degree Fahrenheit for more than 24 hours.

PermissibleValues.value: > 40° C / > 104° F for less than 24 hours
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than 40 Degree Celsius Or Greater Than 104 Degree Fahrenheit For Less Than 24 Hours

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than 40 Degree Celsius Or Greater Than 104 Degree Fahrenheit For Less Than 24 Hours
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A body temperature of greater than 40 degree Celsius or greater than 104 degree Fahrenheit for less than 24 hours.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Less Than 38 Degree Celsius Or Less Than 100.4 Degree Fahrenheit

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than 38 Degree Celsius Or Less Than 100.4 Degree Fahrenheit
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A body temperature of less than 38 degree Celsius or less than 100.4 degree Fahrenheit.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 38 Degree Celsius To 40 Degree Celsius / 100.4 Degree Fahrenheit To 104 Degree Fahrenheit

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 38 Degree Celsius To 40 Degree Celsius / 100.4 Degree Fahrenheit To 104 Degree Fahrenheit
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A body temperature of 38 degree to 40 degree Celsius or 100.4 degree to 104 degree Fahrenheit.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.:the degree of hotness or coldness of a body or environment.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.

A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
